section.name: News and Status
section.p: This document contains the latest news and status regarding the XDoclet project. It is here you'll find announcements related to XDoclet.

subsection.name: Current Status
subsection.p: We are working on XDoclet 2. Click here for more information. Please note that XDoclet 2 development has just started and that it is still far from useable.
Development on the XDoclet 1.2 codebase is happening on the xdoclet-all module.

subsection.name: November ??, 2003 :: XDoclet 1.2 Released
subsection.p: It's been a long time coming, but it's here at last. Over 30 bugs fixed since beta 3. For a detailed changelog, please refer to XDoclet 1.2 Change Log.

subsection.name: October 30, 2003 :: XDoclet Shipped with MacOSX Panther XCode Developer Tools

p.i: I've just installed Panther and since you don't get stuff like CVS installed by default, I decided to open up the XCode CD and install the developer tools. To my surprise there are some Java tools tucked away including Ant, XDoclet, log4j and JBoss.

subsection.p: Simon and Matt blogged about it.

subsection.name: June 18, 2003 :: XDoclet 1.2 Beta 3 Re-released
subsection.p: Due to a packaging error in this release (XJavaDoc was not included), we decided to re-release XDoclet 1.2 Beta 3.

subsection.name: June 13, 2003 :: XDoclet 1.2 Beta 3 Released
subsection.p: This is the last milestone towards our next big release. Over 160 bugs are fixed. For a detailed changelog, please refer to XDoclet 1.2 Beta 3 Change Log.

subsection.name: May, 2003 :: Award for Business Integration and Data Tools
subsection.p: XDoclet won the Award for Business Integration and Data Tools (SD Magazine 05/2003)!

subsection.name: April, 2003 :: TheServerSide Interviews Aslak Hellesoy on XDoclet

p.a: TheServerSide Interviews Aslak Hellesoy on XDoclet.

subsection.name: January 27, 2003 :: JBoss-IDE 1.0 Alpha Released
subsection.p:
JBoss-IDE is a new project with the aim to provide a world class IDE for JBoss. Features are:
The debugging and monitoring of JBoss servers and the controlling of there life cycles.
A very comfortable and sophisticated support for XDoclet.

subsection.name: December 28, 2002 :: XDoclet 1.2 Beta 2 Released
subsection.p: This is the second milestone towards our next big release. Over 50 bugs are fixed. For a detailed changelog, please refer to XDoclet 1.2 Beta 2 Change Log. Happy New Year 2003!

subsection.name: December 27, 2002 :: Java Development with Ant
subsection.p: Near-final release of JavaDevWithAnt demonstrating Ant, XDoclet, Struts, JUnit, Cactus, and Lucene. Very interesting stuff!

subsection.name: December 17, 2002 :: Using Value Objects
subsection.p: Marcus Brito wrote a very detailed document on Value Objects. It is available here.

subsection.name: December 11, 2002 :: xPetStore 2.0 Released
subsection.p: xPetStore: using XDoclet to implement Sun Microsystems' Java Pet Store J2EE BluePrint Application, this application is the ultimate example of XDoclet's power. Also uses Struts and SiteMesh.

subsection.name: December 11, 2002 :: Hibernate Support
subsection.p: As from XDoclet 1.2 Beta 2, XDoclet supports the fantastic Hibernate object/relational persistence and query service for Java.

subsection.name: October 03, 2002 :: XDoclet Team starts using JIRA for Issue Tracking
subsection.p: We decided to use JIRA for issue tracking and project development. We would like to thank Atlassian for their support!

subsection.name: October 02, 2002 :: XDoclet 1.2 Beta 1 Released
subsection.p: This is the first milestone towards our next big release. We believe it's fit for use, but there's probably a few bugs left and the documentation still needs some work. Bug reports, as always, are welcome. For a detailed changelog, please refer to XDoclet 1.2 Beta 1 Change Log.
